sentences.en: As long as most people are happy to have the monarchy, the abolitionist position is an arrogant fantasy.
sentences.cn: 只要大多数人还乐意保留君主制，废除它的主张就是痴人说梦。

sentences.en: He found most of them insufferably arrogant.
sentences.cn: 他发现他们当中大部分人都傲慢得让人难以忍受。

sentences.en: He is spoiled, arrogant and has a tendency towards snobbery.
sentences.cn: 他被宠坏了，傲慢无礼，而且经常自命不凡。
他的傲慢让人无法忍受。
他是个傲慢的小讨厌鬼！

sentences.en: His manner is supercilious and arrogant.
I didn't like him at all. I thought he was cool, aloof, and arrogant.
sentences.cn: 我一点也不喜欢他，觉得他冷漠、孤僻而且傲慢。

sentences.en: I thought him conceited and arrogant.
sentences.cn: 我认为他既自负又傲慢。

sentences.en: Is she aloof and arrogant or just shy?
sentences.cn: 她是冷漠傲慢还是仅仅是害羞?

sentences.en: People are waking up that he is arrogant.
sentences.cn: 人们开始认识到他很傲慢.

sentences.en: She was said to be proud and arrogant.
She was selfish, arrogant and often callous.
sentences.cn: 她自私傲慢,而且往往冷酷无情.

sentences.en: The tone of his book is consistently negative, occasionally arrogant, and often superficial.
sentences.cn: 他的书基调一贯是负面消极的，有时还有点儿傲慢自大，且常常流于肤浅。

sentences.en: You've got to get rid of your arrogant ways.
sentences.cn: 你这骄傲劲儿得好好改改.

trans.tran_en: behaving in an unpleasant or rude way because you think you are more important than other people
